channel.title: Rust
channel.description:
So I started playing last night, died from a demon dog, again by a lying bandit and then once more by a bandit while running away from demon dogs. Lovely game! In all honesty, it's really fun to play. Though it sucks when you don't know the layout of the map, I cant find my friend for shit and I'm carrying a load of everything. [spoiler][img]http://i.imgur.com/ebEjlWk.jpg[/img][/spoiler]
I've always had fun with not knowing the map, I like to feel like I'm lost and have no clue but in the back of your head you feel like you've been around here before.

item.title: Rust
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

Started playing this again with Pure, about 9 hours work:

As you can see, we’re very welcoming to the community. 4 layers of spikes both wood/metal tinted, inside the building is another building which is heavily armoured with a good structure, spikes and building cabinets placed around the area with land mines/snap traps to catch people who wonder and siege towers.

Read full topic

item.title: Rust
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

It needs to hurry up and figure out a beta stage

Read full topic

item.title: Rust
item.dc:creator: @iCreatedHorror Ryan
item.description:
@iCreatedHorror wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:4, topic:541505”][quote author=iCreatedHorror link=topic=660374.msg4415564#msg4415564 date=1395760373]

I enjoy Rust, it’s fun to spend some time on I guess. I can’t spend hours at a time on it as I can with DayZ though, it just bores me to tears after a while. As long as you play with friends and get a decent base set up then you’re winning.
[/quote]Alone it’s crap in my opinion (though I feel the same way about playing DayZ alone). Although, even with friends, you have to play a populated server with no stupid rules (PvP disabled, sleepers off, insta-craft, etc.) to make it actually be fun.

If I was to play DayZ alone without my squad I reckon I’d last about an hour. It’s a terrible game without companionship. From what I hear Rust has more players than DayZ. Quite a feat I suppose.[/quote]I haven’t actually logged onto DayZ in awhile (haven’t had time nor friends to play with) although I heard it’s getting better slowly from when it came out. The problem with both games is that they get so repetitive after a few hours.

Read full topic

item.title: Rust
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“iCreatedHorror, post:3, topic:541505”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=660374.msg4415562#msg4415562 date=1395760246]
I enjoy Rust, it’s fun to spend some time on I guess. I can’t spend hours at a time on it as I can with DayZ though, it just bores me to tears after a while. As long as you play with friends and get a decent base set up then you’re winning.
[/quote]Alone it’s crap in my opinion (though I feel the same way about playing DayZ alone). Although, even with friends, you have to play a populated server with no stupid rules (PvP disabled, sleepers off, insta-craft, etc.) to make it actually be fun.[/quote]
If I was to play DayZ alone without my squad I reckon I’d last about an hour. It’s a terrible game without companionship. From what I hear Rust has more players than DayZ. Quite a feat I suppose.

Read full topic
